definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: It contains the whole gospel and the essence of the covenant of grace. It has been in great measure fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 应许中涵盖了全本的福音，也蕴藏著恩典之约的精髓。

sentences.english: There are not words enough in the unabridged to describe it.
sentences.chinese: 翻遍了全本的词典也凑不够词来形容啊。

sentences.english: It is very long, spanning ten nights in ten episodes.
sentences.chinese: 这部剧非常长，全本十集要演十个晚上。

sentences.english: Disney (DIS, Fortune 500), at the depth of the Great Depression, proposing a full-length feature cartoon.
sentences.chinese: 迪斯尼，在大萧条的衰落中推出了全本故事卡通。

sentences.english: WE AFFIRM that the written Word in its entirety is revelation given by God.
sentences.chinese: 全本圣经都是神恩赐的启示。

definition: omnibus/complete works (of a writer or artist)
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
manuscript copy of a book (before the printing press)
Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus (1617), Ming dynasty vernacular novel, formerly notorious and banned for its sexual content
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
to read a sample chapter of a book/to subscribe to a publication on a trial basis/to attend classes on a trial basis
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story
The Carnal Prayer Mat, Chinese erotic novel from 17th century, usually attributed to Li Yu 李漁|李渔[Li3 Yu3]
